newsitem.title: CHINA: China dissatisfied with U.S. over Clinton-Dalai meeting.
newsitem.headline: China dissatisfied with U.S. over Clinton-Dalai meeting.

text.p: China said on Thursday it had voiced its strong dissatisfaction to the United States for allowing the Dalai Lama to meet U.S. leaders in Washington this week.
"We express our adamant opposition to any actions that tolerate or support the Dalai Lama's activities to split the motherland," a Foreign Ministry spokesman said.

"We are strongly dissatisfied with the United States for allowing the Dalai Lama to carry out splittist activities in the United States, and with U.S. leaders for meeting him," the spokesman told a news briefing.
"We have already expressed our serious and principled stance to the U.S. side," he said.

President Bill Clinton ignored warnings from Beijing and met the Dalai Lama at the White House on Wednesday. Clinton told the exiled Tibetan leader he would urge China to open a direct dialogue with him.
